properties.detail: Cuyahoga Valley National Park requested a commercial services analysis and strategy to aid the park in examining how commercial services could diversify recreation opportunities and make better use of the existing facilities to serve the visiting public. Consultants will suggest potential program improvements as well as recommendations for expansion and new services.

Fire Island National Seashore requested BPI assistance in developing a strategic approach to managing its leasing program. The project will design formal processes and establish appropriate capacity to allow for potential expansion of the program to include several other high-potential locations.

Buffalo National Scenic River has requested BPI assistance with developing a comprehensive facilities investment strategy. The evaluation will include analysis of facility utilization by the park and its visitors, current condition, projected facility needs, resource impacts, and recommendations for overall investment strategies over the next 10 years.

Golden Gate National Recreation Area is studying options to improve transportation to and within the parklands around the Golden Gate Bridge. BPI consultants will develop a business model and approach for a cooperative management agreement and shuttle transportation system, including transportation data analysis, financial modeling of pricing structures and cost-sharing options, developing performance metrics, and implementation strategies.

Redwood National and State Parks has requested BPI consultants assist them by facilitating a transparent, parkwide workforce and budget planning process in order to regain some financial flexibility. The project will focus on the NPS workforce and its priorities, but will account for critical contributions from its State and non-profit partners.

Mount Rainier National Park is seeking assistance from BPI to understand how to manage projects with minimal strain on continuing operations, especially during the summer season. The project will help the park manage multiple projects from various fund sources while continuing operations (e.g. administrative support, planning and compliance, project management support, or park housing), and will augment their project prioritization, planning, and development process.
